document.discussion_title: Oil Drops After Iraq Seeks Export Boost as Nigeria Attacks End
document.topic_text: Oil Drops After Iraq Seeks Export Boost as Nigeria Attacks End From OPEC NewsAugust 22, 2016 - 2:30am Oil fell after the longest run of gains in four years as Iraq seeks to increase exports amid a global overhang of crude inventories and as Nigerian militants call an end to hostilities. Futures fell as much as 1.2 percent in New York after climbing 16 percent over the previous seven sessions amid speculation informal OPEC talks next month may lead to action to stabilize the market. Share this article »
